before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"b1g9t","text":"Solution PW1 must be warmed at 55°C for 5–10 minutes to dissolve precipitates prior to use. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aokhq","text":"Solution PW1 should be used while still warm.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qle","text":"If Solution PW3 has precipitated, heat at 55°C for 5–10 minutes to dissolve precipitate.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qn6d","text":"Shake to mix Solution PW4 before use.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6thfm","text":"Perform all centrifugation steps at room temperature (15–25°C).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4torc","text":"QIAGEN DNeasy PowerWater SOP","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9jj8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gjcl","text":"Purpose: For the isolation of genomic DNA from filter water samples, inculding turbid water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ag8e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4a3i7","text":"Introduction: The DNeasy PowerWater Kit can isolate genomic DNA from a variety of filtered water samples. Utilizing Inhibitor Removal Technology® (IRT), even water containing heavy amounts of contaminants can be processed to provide DNA of high quality and yield. The DNeasy PowerWater Kit can isolate DNA equally well from any commonly used type of filter membrane. Purified DNA is ready to use in a final elution volume of 100 μl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fumvi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ksn1","text":"Principle \u0026 Procedure: The DNeasy PowerWater Kit starts with the filtration of a water sample onto a filter membrane. Filter membranes may be user supplied. The membrane is then added to our special 5 ml bead beating tube containing a unique bead mix. Rapid and thorough lysis occurs through vortexing in a specially formulated lysis buffer that enhances the isolation of microorganisms from filter membranes. After the protein and inhibitor removal steps, total genomic DNA is captured on an MB Spin Column. High-quality DNA is then washed and eluted from the MB Spin Column membrane for use in downstream applications including PCR and qPCR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4aqh","text":"Filter water samples using a filter funnel attached to a vacuum source. The volume of water filtered will depend on the microbial load and turbidity of the water sample. See below for types of water samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f4un8","text":"If using a reusable filter funnel, remove the upper portion of the apparatus.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d85na","text":"Using two sets of sterile forceps, pick up the white filter membrane at opposite edges and roll the filter into a cylinder with the top side facing inward.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"51bia","text":"Insert the filter into a    PowerWater DNA Bead Tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":25,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5b3g2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"38BC9EF03DA011ECAD58F5735D928365","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9lca","text":"Add    of Solution PW1 to the PowerWater DNA Bead Tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2lhk4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"41651CD03DA011ECAD58F5735D928365","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eherv","text":"Clear water samples: Larger volumes of clear water can be processed because there is less chance of filter clogging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87ts0","text":"Potable drinking water will generally allow for very high volumes depending on the quality and particulate count. In most cases,   to    can be processed, although some users report processing even higher volumes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":129,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":134,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6jnc4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"0DCA34A03DA011ECAD58F5735D928365","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"222C68003DA011ECAD58F5735D928365","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"nk6","text":"Turbid Water Samples: Turbid samples with high levels of suspended solids or sediments will tend to clog filters with","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"448sn","text":"smaller pore sizes (0.22 μm). Use of 0.45 μm filters is recommended for these types of samples. Prior to filtering, samples can be stored in a container to allow suspended solids to settle out. For samples where settling does not occur or is not desired, a method involving stacking filters with larger pore sizes on top of the filter membrane of the desired pore size is recommended. A common set-up is to stack a sterile 1 μm filter. This layering will filter out large debris and allow the smaller micron filter to trap microorganisms. The layered filter system can be washed with sterile water or sterile phosphate buffer to knock down some of the trapped microorganisms on the larger pore size filters. Although this is not completely efficient, it will increase the overall yield of microbial DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8v4ms","text":"For samples containing organisms that are difficult to lyse (e.g. fungi, algae) an additional heating step can be included. Heating can aid the lysis of some organisms (fungi, algae). After adding Solution PW1 (Step 5 of the protocol), heat the sample at    for   . Resume protocol from step 6. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":256,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":262,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9k42","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F735DF003D9F11ECAD58F5735D928365","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"65","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"0038D8F03DA011ECAD58F5735D928365","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42c4k","text":"Secure the tube horizontally to a Vortex Adapter (cat. no. 13000-V1-5/13000-V1-15).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cv7do","text":"Vortex at maximum speed for   . Centrifuge the tubes at    (This centrifugation step is optional if a centrifuge with a     tube rotor is not available, but will result in minor loss of supernatant).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":56,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":121,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bat1l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"533B00003DA011ECAD58F5735D928365","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"4000","duration":60,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"6DC966A03DA011ECAD58F5735D928365","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":34}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"814FB8F03DA011ECAD58F5735D928365","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgnen","text":"Transfer the supernatant to a clean     Collection Tube (provided). Draw up the supernatant using a  pipette tip by placing it down into the beads. (Note: Placing the pipette tip down into the beads is required. Pipette until you have removed all the supernatant. Expect to recover    of supernatant.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":149,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":37,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":100,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":283,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3u64b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"8C62CE303DA011ECAD58F5735D928365","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"9C222D703DA011ECAD58F5735D928365","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"600-650","error":false,"guid":"B05BCA303DA011ECAD58F5735D928365","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":true,"unit":1}}}}
